trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement - API integration
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement - API integration

trans-unit.source: In an automated marketing system, creating and activating the marketing campaigns also occur automatically.
trans-unit.target: In an automated marketing system, creating and activating the marketing campaigns also occur automatically.

trans-unit.source: For this purpose - Azure Mobile Engagement enables creating such automated marketing campaigns using APIs as well.
trans-unit.target: For this purpose - Azure Mobile Engagement enables creating such automated marketing campaigns using APIs as well.

trans-unit.source: Typically customers use the Mobile Engagement front end interface to create announcements/polls etc as part of their marketing campaigns.
trans-unit.target: Typically customers use the Mobile Engagement front end interface to create announcements/polls etc as part of their marketing campaigns.

trans-unit.source: However as the marketing campaigns become mature, there is a need to leverage the data locked in the backend systems (like any CRM system or CMS system like SharePoint) so that a fully automated pipeline can be created which creates campaigns in Mobile Engagement dynamically based on the data flowing in from the backend systems.
trans-unit.target: However as the marketing campaigns become mature, there is a need to leverage the data locked in the backend systems (like any CRM system or CMS system like SharePoint) so that a fully automated pipeline can be created which creates campaigns in Mobile Engagement dynamically based on the data flowing in from the backend systems.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial goes through such a scenario where a SharePoint business user populates a SharePoint list with marketing data and an automated process picks up items from the list and connects with the Mobile Engagement system using the available REST APIs to create a marketing campaign from the SharePoint data.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial goes through such a scenario where a SharePoint business user populates a SharePoint list with marketing data and an automated process picks up items from the list and connects with the Mobile Engagement system using the available REST APIs to create a marketing campaign from the SharePoint data.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] In general, you can use this sample as a starting point for understanding how to call any Mobile Engagement REST API as it details the two key aspects of calling the APIs - authenticating and passing parameters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] In general, you can use this sample as a starting point for understanding how to call any Mobile Engagement REST API as it details the two key aspects of calling the APIs - authenticating and passing parameters.

trans-unit.source: Here is what the sample SharePoint list looks like.
trans-unit.target: Here is what the sample SharePoint list looks like.

trans-unit.source: **Title**, **Category**, **NotificationTitle**, **Message** and **URL** are used for creating the announcement.
trans-unit.target: **Title**, **Category**, **NotificationTitle**, **Message** and **URL** are used for creating the announcement.

trans-unit.source: There is a column called **IsProcessed** which is used by the sample automation process in the form of a console program.
trans-unit.target: There is a column called **IsProcessed** which is used by the sample automation process in the form of a console program.

trans-unit.source: You can either run this console program as an Azure WebJob so that you can schedule it or you can directly use the SharePoint workflow to program creating and activating the announcement when an item is inserted into the SharePoint list.
trans-unit.target: You can either run this console program as an Azure WebJob so that you can schedule it or you can directly use the SharePoint workflow to program creating and activating the announcement when an item is inserted into the SharePoint list.

trans-unit.source: In this sample we use the console program which goes through the items in the SharePoint list and create announcement in Azure Mobile Engagement for each of them and then finally marks the **IsProcessed** flag to be true on successful announcement creation.
trans-unit.target: In this sample we use the console program which goes through the items in the SharePoint list and create announcement in Azure Mobile Engagement for each of them and then finally marks the **IsProcessed** flag to be true on successful announcement creation.

trans-unit.source: We are using the code from the sample *Remote Authentication in SharePoint Online Using the Client Object Model* [here](https://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Remote-Authentication-in-b7b6f43c) to authenticate with the SharePoint list.
trans-unit.target: We are using the code from the sample *Remote Authentication in SharePoint Online Using the Client Object Model* [here](https://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Remote-Authentication-in-b7b6f43c) to authenticate with the SharePoint list.

trans-unit.source: Once authenticated, we loop through the list items to find out any newly created items (which will have **IsProcessed** = false).
trans-unit.target: Once authenticated, we loop through the list items to find out any newly created items (which will have **IsProcessed** = false).

trans-unit.source: Mobile Engagement integration
trans-unit.target: Mobile Engagement integration

trans-unit.source: Once we find an item which requires processing - we extract the information required to create an announcement from the list item and call `CreateAzMECampaign` to create it and subsequently `ActivateAzMECampaign` to activate it.
trans-unit.target: Once we find an item which requires processing - we extract the information required to create an announcement from the list item and call `CreateAzMECampaign` to create it and subsequently `ActivateAzMECampaign` to activate it.

trans-unit.source: These are essentially REST API calls calling to the Mobile Engagement backend.
trans-unit.target: These are essentially REST API calls calling to the Mobile Engagement backend.

trans-unit.source: The Mobile Engagement REST APIs require a **Basic auth scheme authorization HTTP header** which is composed of the `ApplicationId` and the `ApiKey` which you get from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: The Mobile Engagement REST APIs require a **Basic auth scheme authorization HTTP header** which is composed of the `ApplicationId` and the `ApiKey` which you get from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the Key from the **api keys** section and *not* from the **sdk keys** section.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the Key from the **api keys** section and *not* from the **sdk keys** section.

trans-unit.source: For creating the announcement type campaign - refer to the [documentation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn913754.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For creating the announcement type campaign - refer to the [documentation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn913754.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You need to make sure that you are specifying the campaign `kind` as *announcement* and the [payload](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn913749.aspx) and passing it as FormUrlEncodedContent.
trans-unit.target: You need to make sure that you are specifying the campaign `kind` as *announcement* and the [payload](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn913749.aspx) and passing it as FormUrlEncodedContent.

trans-unit.source: `CreateAzMECampaign` creates an announcement campaign and returns its Id to the caller.
trans-unit.target: `CreateAzMECampaign` creates an announcement campaign and returns its Id to the caller.

trans-unit.source: `ActivateAzMECampaign` requires this Id as the parameter to activate the campaign.
